lexUnit.name: tourist.n

document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who travels for pleasure.

sentence.text: There are also souvenir stands , benches for a rest , and perhaps Hong Kong 's last surviving rickshaws - however these are not for rides , but are a tourist photo opportunity .
A prosperous tourist district , it is full of shopping centers and department stores , along with a number of good restaurants .
Aberdeen 's theatrical floating restaurants have been a tourist attraction for many years .
Ask the tourist authority about its interesting Heritage Tour from Kowloon and other countryside tours ( see page 113 ) .

The lookout point at Lok Ma Chau was once known as Hong Kong 's `` window on China `` - in the years of China 's isolation from the West , tourists would come to the lookout point here and rent binoculars in order to get a glimpse of the great mystery beyond .
Shenzhen 's main tourist attractions are its enormous theme parks .
It really looks the part ; the tourists know its name even before the guide can translate it .
English is spoken in hotels and tourist destinations .
Browsing is a real pleasure in Macau 's main streets and byways , where shops aimed at the tourist market are interspersed with the more workaday ironmongers , herbalists , and noodle stalls .
By way of formal tourist attractions , Pak Tai Temple , built in 1783 , has some fine carvings and a great iron sword said to be 600 years old .
Upon arrival in Macau , be sure to stop by the Macau Government Tourist Office for a map , brochures , and directions .
Pedicabs were once the most common form of transportation in Macau , but today they are mainly a tourist attraction .
